text:
I'm trying to display the VSS history, but I keep getting this error -

[vsshistory] ***: ss History $/BMR -I- -Vd31.05.2002~d01.01.2002 -R

BUILD FAILED

C:\ANTbuild\build.xml:9: java.io.IOException: CreateProcess: ss History $/BMR -I
- -Vd31.05.2002~d01.01.2002 -R error=2

This is my build file....

<?xml version="1.0"?>
<project name="ABC Project" default="package" basedir=".">
	<target name="init">
	<tstamp/>
	<echo message="HELLO Sandeep"/>
	<vsshistory vsspath="/BMR" recursive="true"
            fromDate="01.01.2002"
            toDate="31.05.2002"/>
	</target>
</project>

Any help would be highly appreciated.

Thanks,
Sandeep
creator: akhouri_s@hotmail.com
jesse@cryptocard.com
text:
Is ss.exe in your path?

If it is can you run with -debug. You should see the command line that Ant is
running. Copy the command line to a dos session and see if it completes properly.

If it works outside of ant post the -debug output.

Jesse

creator: jesse@cryptocard.com
text:
This can be closed 

Sandeep and I had a off list email exchange and solved his problem.

<-- msg from Sandeep -->
 Thanks for your mail. I put the path to ss.exe in PATH and ran with the
 -debug option from the command prompt. The message that I get is ->

 No VSS database [srcsafe.ini] found.
<-- snip -->


<-- My reply -->
You need to set the "serverPath" attribute.
<-- snip -->

<-- reply from Sandeep -->
thanks !
<-- snip-->

I send him an email asking to close the bug.

Jesse
